website_summaries.verdict: An easy gluten-free bread mix that lets you bake it at home in the style you want.
pros: Free of gluten, wheat, and dairy, and it's kosher
Pack of 6 will keep and last a long time
Just add eggs (or egg substitute), oil, water, and yeast
Great for those with bread makers
cons: Not ready to serve like the premade breads on our list

customer_reviews.title: Terrible for Baking
customer_reviews.text: Worst gluten free flour for baking, retains too much moisture. King Arthur gluten free flour bakes just like wheat flour. I have tried several recipes with both - King Arthur is superior to Pamela's.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: No thanks
customer_reviews.text: Gummy and heavy on the starches. Even using a mixer to try and force some air into my baked goods, the end results were halfway between white bread and glue. Their original baking and pancake mix is one of our favorites. This one, like most other "works great with your conventional recipes" is just a great way to spike your blood sugar with poor tasting results. I experimented with the entire bag - followed instructions on tweaks to improve the results, did some troubleshooting with tricks I've learned over ten years of being gluten free and a picky, but frequent, baker - I could not get a good result out of this.
customer_reviews.author: Nessy

customer_reviews.title: Cut with sugar.
customer_reviews.text: I used to like this flour mix. It's sweet. I hadn't purchased in a while as our grocery store doesn't carry it anymore. Eventually I purchased this. It seems this large bag is cut with more sugar than the small bags but it's just to sweet for bread. If you're making cake it would be fine but I have a stomach ache from a breakfast biscuit. Gross. I don't know what to do with all this flour I waisted my money on.
customer_reviews.author: CS72

customer_reviews.title: The best gluten free bread!
customer_reviews.text: Pamela's bread mix is a little bit pricey, but it's worth every cent! In our household of eight, four of us have Celiac and a fifth has a wheat allergy so we've tried so many breads and have been disappointed over and over. We gave Pamela's a try (we make it in our breadmaker - so easy) and now have it on subscribe and save so we get a half dozen packages almost every month. The taste and texture are excellent. If you can't have gluten, this really is the best bread mix out there!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie and Heather Hejduk

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a blend without xanthan and was excited to find this. But this made the worst batch of cookies. Dense and rubbery, they all went into the trash. I am an experienced cook and have made many gluten free cookies. This was my first bag of this flour and will be my last. Now I have 4 pounds of a product I will not be using again.
customer_reviews.author: P. Martin

customer_reviews.title: 25 lb bag is way less expensive and worth it!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have tried a few other gluten-free flowers and always come back to Pamelas! the flavor it’s ease of use the good fluffy rise that we get in the bread and the easy instructions are all great. If you’re switching to homemade bread this works well in a bread machine AND in recipes in your blender. For high altitude (3300ft here) add 1 extra teaspoon of yeast and 2 tablespoons of water. FYI drop a cup of golden raisins in during the blending and you get amazing Raisin toast
customer_reviews.author: Jack Myers

customer_reviews.title: One of the best gluten free flours on the market!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best gluten free flours that I have ever used, and I have tried A BUNCH! It has more starches in it than other brands so it works very well for things like biscuits, dumplings, baked goods, gravy, frying chicken, etc. It isn’t fully a 1:1, but it is much closer to it than other brands. I don’t think I have found a gluten free flour that is truly 1:1 with recipes, so that is saying a lot. Try it, you won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.author: MrsO

customer_reviews.title: This mix does not work in my bread machine
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mix because it is advertised to work in bread machines. It does not work in my breadman ultimate machine at all. The resulting loaf is dense, heavy, and wet. So far, I have made 4 of the 6 packs that I got, and varying the amounts of water/oil from the directions does not help, and I always proof the yeast. (My machine makes regular bread without any problems.)
customer_reviews.author: S. Block

customer_reviews.title: Best GF sugar cookies ever!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried so many different GF flours: almond, rice, coconut, blends from Bob's Red Mill, Trader Joe's, etc...you name it. This one may just be my new favorite. I made a batch of sugar cookies with a regular recipe, substituting this flour for regular flour. No adjustments, easy peasy. And.... They were the best GF cookies I have ever made! No one could even tell they were GF--they were just buttery and delicious. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: RubyTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: This is THE BEST Mix out there
customer_reviews.text: There is no comparison. This is THE BEST Mix out there. I have made a wonderful YEAST FREE bread that rises and is so delicious, my husband and friends are amazed. We choose Yeast Free Recipes because Yeast promotes yeast infections (candida over growth) in both men and women. Now, I can have biscuits, bread, cakes, cookies (all using Xylitol and Stevia for sweetener) and they pass my former "sugar addict" husband's approval! Thank You Pamela!
customer_reviews.author: Chrystal

customer_reviews.title: GF staple
customer_reviews.text: I really love Pamela’s and have sworn by them for the most part. I use this blend for cookies, quick breads, and cakes with great results. And then I went to a GF friend’s house and she made the most amazing pancakes with Bob’s Red Mill 1 to 1 Baking Flour. For things like pancakes and crepes, I find the Pamela’s to thicken up too much. So I’d given up on crepes and pancakes from scratch were also too thick. I’ve tried the Pamela’s pancake mix, but the fam is not too crazy about the over abundance of course ground almond in it.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: this bag is different
customer_reviews.text: Something is wrong with this bag of flour, it is not the same. Every single loaf from the last 25 lbs bag turned out perfect in my bread machine. Today I have made two loaves from this new bag, both have the consistency of a bagel , way more dense. These two loaves have baked up in a glob shape. The taste is way off also. I believe I was shipped something other than what I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: And it was very hard time for me because I love to bake and eat
customer_reviews.text: I became gluten free. And it was very hard time for me because I love to bake and eat. I read reviews and chose this one and I'm so satisfied. Whatever I bake is delicious, my family didn't see any different in all my cakes which I baked before and compare with the stores prices it is good , very good price.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Crazy good!  my family of four killed a loaf at one sitting
customer_reviews.text: It's the most delicious gluten-free bread I've tried in my life!!! And I lead a gluten-free lifestyle. This bread is so good, my family of four killed a loaf at one sitting. I couldn't make them it dinner everyone was so loving THE BREAD :) Funny enough, we all know that majority of gluten-free food taste like sawdust :) So this mix is a must have!!! Your kids will love it, your hubby will love it and even your mom-in-low will love it! Yeah!!! And it smells like heavens. Fair warning: you might drool extensively while it bakes
customer_reviews.author: Yulia

customer_reviews.title: Okay.
customer_reviews.text: I guess it is impossible to find a really good pre-mixed AP GF flour. The problems I have with this one are that it does not taste super great--not bad, just not really good. I think it tastes a teeny bit stale (even though it's not) in cookies. I also don't like that it has guar gum. It messes up the texture, like if I'm making Yorkshire pudding it gets a skin on top and doesn't want to fluff up. I buy it anyway for convenience and price. My kids are not picky and don't notice the things I just got done complaining about.
customer_reviews.author: Criticalmom

customer_reviews.title: Good for some recipes, not others
customer_reviews.text: Pros: doesn't have as grainy a texture as other gluten free flours, makes excellent cookies and sweet treats Cons: not really 1 for 1 (had to add a ton of water for my waffle recipe and had to add a lot of flour to my cookie recipe), is very gummy in certain recipes In conclusion, you may have some trial and error with this flour, unlike other flours that are a true 1 to 1 (we really like king arthur). I would say it's better in sweet treats and maybe not so good for breads. Our waffles were disgustingly gummy, had to throw away the batter.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Great Flour.  Easy To Work With.  Bread Tastes Great!
customer_reviews.text: Got our brand new bread maker a few weeks ago. Our old one from years ago did not have a Gluten Free Cycle. We first bought the three "4 lb" bags and went through them in a few weeks. The recipe on the back of the bag was perfect. So...we decided just to go large; but same great flour. As a tip, I put the bag inside a white Hefty Garbage bag to "double" seal it...so no worries there. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: The Woj

customer_reviews.title: Best brand of glue free bread and I've tried them all
customer_reviews.text: Best brand of glue free bread and I've tried them all! Easy to cook up and tastes great. My advice is to definitely follow the instructions on the bag and let the dough beat in the stand mixer for a good 5 minutes. I use butter instead of oil. Grease your bread pans well. Very light and not dense at all. Stores nicely in the refrigerator. I can store it in the freezer too, although expect it to be a bit more crumbly but that hasn't been a real issue for me. Definitely my favorite gluten free bread.
customer_reviews.author: Frances

customer_reviews.title: I love Pamela's products.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great GF flour, some don't work well w/yeast recipes, but this one does. the price is affordable and the quality of the flour mixture is a perfect blend. I love that it has Guar Gum and Sorghum already added in, it saves me from having to buy those separately, they seem to be a big part of GF baking. If there is one thing that I don't like about this flour, is its very white, it makes my yeast bread look funny. Having said that, I will continue to purchase this brand.
customer_reviews.author: kky@email.arizona.edu

customer_reviews.title: Hard Pass on Pamela's Gluten Free
customer_reviews.text: I really don't mind saying - because I've made a huge mess in my kitchen 3 times with this flour - it's awful. I've made pizza dough a million times with AP/Bread flour so I know how to mix up dough. This stuff never forms up in an electric mixer, it just pools at the bottom of the mixing bowl. When I try to roll more flour in to it on the counter top it sticks to my fingers no matter how much extra flour I add. It never rises no matter how much yeast I add to the recipe also. I'd never buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: The best GF all purpose flour I've found!
customer_reviews.text: I like Pamela's flour the best, and I've tried several gluten free flours. I developed an allergy to gluten later in life, just 3 years ago. After trying several already made GF food items, I decided that it was just easier and better tasting to make my own. I've adapted many recipes using Pamela's flour, even incredible-tasting flour tortillas from scratch. I usually have to increase the fat used in a recipe, and sometimes the liquid as well. I find it the best compliment when people tell me that they would never believe that what they're eating is gluten free!!
customer_reviews.author: EmBee

customer_reviews.title: My favorite gluten free flour blend
customer_reviews.text: My favorite gluten free flour blend. I was trying a few different brands - this was the first. After comparing to some others - this is really the best! I use this cup for cup with regular flour recipes for cookies and it works great. It also works well with my gluten free recipes that call for different flours and xantham. They also recently updated the package to have a more of a Velcro type closure instead of the old zip loc which was terrible to close
customer_reviews.author: Tk

customer_reviews.title: A Favorite
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased this flour when I wanted to try the gluten free chocolate chip cookie recipe from Yes Divas Can Cook (Youtube channel and blog). She recommends this specific gf flour. I make it without eggs (use flax eggs instead) and plant-based fat sources, and they still come out great. I have found that this flour works well in many recipes. My entire family enjoys it, and only two of us actually have dietary restrictions.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: What has happened to Pamela's flour? I have used this product for years and it was wonderful. However, along with the 'GREAT LOOK' came something else AWFUL baked products. Do NOT use this flour if you want to present an attractive baked product. It is a waste of your time and produces nothing you will want to eat. The muffins were doughy and ugly to look at. I will never recommend this flour again and I will never buy the flour again. Just awful!
customer_reviews.author: JJD&JAD32

customer_reviews.title: Lot # 121901V Defective
customer_reviews.text: I buy this on a regular basis. The consistency is always right on the mark. This batch however, kept turning out watery. I found myself having to add about 2/3 a cup of spelt to it so it could rise and bake properly. Otherwise, it turns out heavy and flat like a pound cake. This product isn't cheap and I'm leary of keeping up with my subscription.
customer_reviews.author: Hershey Handyman

customer_reviews.title: What's changed?
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying this bread mix for years, my bread has always been perfect. Somethings changed as my bread has come out gummy no matter what changes I make. Been doing this for years, very disappointed will not order again. Gotta throw it out I guess, too bad.
customer_reviews.author: J Mac

customer_reviews.title: Great Bread Mix for Celiacs
customer_reviews.text: Been buying this for years, first from supermarkets, but in later years from Amazon when it was sometimes hard to find in supermarkets. Never had a problem with the Amazon version - always on time, and well-packaged by Pamela's in a sturdy carton of 6. My wife is a celiac, and really likes this stuff. We bake two packages (two loaves) at a time, and add some flax meal for a fiber boost. For a two loaf mix (2 packages of Pamela's), we add additions to the Pamela's recipe: 1 cup of flax meal, 1 teaspoon of gluten-free yeast, 4 tablespoons of water, and 3 tablespoons of oil.
customer_reviews.author: Southern_Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great Light and airy flour! Perfect for my needs!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good gluten free flour...this one is REALLY good! I used it to fry fish in my Air Fryer (this was my first time using) and it was wonderful! No bad taste, my seasonings were the only flavor which was awesome! Just a light and airy, slightly crunchy texture! When I try it for gravy and baking, I’ll come back and update my review. As of right now, I love it and would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: 1SewSweet

customer_reviews.title: My life had changed!!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh crap...I’m in love!!! I have made 3 loaves of bread so far and also some hamburger buns. My last loaf I made into a garlic rosemary bread and it was amazing! On my first loaf I screwed up because I am so used to working with regular bread dough and I didn’t realize how runny GF dough is. Once I figured it out, my life changed! There are 3 of us in my family who are GF and they were all in love with it tonight!
customer_reviews.author: IdahoFolks

customer_reviews.title: Great Gluten Free Flour
customer_reviews.text: I love this gluten and dairy free flour as an option for baking. There are other gluten free flours out there that are just as good but sometimes contain dairy, which generally I like to avoid, since I use this flour for "cleaner" baked goods. There is a slight different in comparison to regular flours but with baked goods, it's not too obvious. Pamela's Products are one of the best gluten free options out there and I recommend them if eating gluten free is a preference or a necessity.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene

customer_reviews.title: Great Gluten Free Mix..and revipes!
customer_reviews.text: Used it to make rolls, bread, turkey stuffing, and cookies. All recipes found on Pamela's internet site, all worked really well. Only baking that was a little crumbly was a pie crust....hard to get it to stick together very well. But I still give thus a 5 star, as it made our first attempt at a gluten-free holiday dinner a real success! Even the green bean casserole made with coconut milk, and gluten free fried onions was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Rouser

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: One of the best tasting flours I have found. I have celiacs so I am having to navigate the odd gluten free cooking. It does take more liquid and extra whisking but that is typical of any of the gluten free flours. So much better than rice flour and Bob's Red Mill Flour. This is a good price and amount. I will continue to purchase this. Very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Dispatcher in field

customer_reviews.title: STOP if you have a Treenuts, Coconut, Eggs, Soy or Milk Allergy
customer_reviews.text: The item description nor the photos depicted package statements, “..our products are produced on equipment that processes tree nuts, coconut, eggs, soy, and milk ..” we have a severe nut allergic son and had I known this info I would not have purchased it ...wasting time, & money on our end and Amazon’s, not to mention my son’s disappointment in not being able to make his own bread. The seller should post a FULL picture so buyers are fully aware.
customer_reviews.author: Best Busy Boys

customer_reviews.title: I like it, its good for a gluten free flour
customer_reviews.text: I like it, its good for a gluten free flour , it will never be like regular wheat based flour so when you make pizza dough its real doughy tasting and chewy feeling like its raw but in breads its good and the same with cookies as you cant tell in the cookies or if you make fudgy brownies you cant tell they have gluten free flour in them . When making loaves of bread I tend to add a little oat and rice flour to this as well to make it less doughy feeling
customer_reviews.author: J. Hartman

customer_reviews.title: This is the best mix I have tried
customer_reviews.text: This is the best mix I have tried. The bread recipe on the back of package is very easy and bullet proof. I have forgotten to preheat oven, and etc. and the loaf comes out perfect anyway. I also find that the bread is not sticky and underdone inside even though I only bake it to 200 degrees internal temp. This is not true with other recipes I have tried. I have really enjoyed using it because it tastes much better that "store bought" gluten free bread and is just a fraction of the price. My non GF family members even like it which is saying something.
customer_reviews.author: salley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for scratch baking using all your old recipes.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Pamela's baking and Pancake flour since I was first diagnosed with Celiacs. Despite the ease of use of that flour and the overall great quality, I've wanted a Gluten Free All purpose flour that was just flour...no other components (baking powder, baking soda etc). This offering from Pamela's meets that desire. I can now pull out the recipes that came from my mother and grandmother and make the treats that I remember growing up.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Best Gluten Free Bread
customer_reviews.text: EASY to use gluten free bread mix. If you are a celiac and need to eat gluten free, there is not a good choice for purchasing pre-made, good tasting GF bread. This bread is "FANTASTIC". The yeast is inside the bag, all you do is add eggs, oil and hot water. I recommend investing in a "USA Bread Pan", the best bread pan I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Feels and bakes like wheat flour.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a large number of gluten free flours since I was diagnosed with Celiac Disease 8 years ago and none of them even come close to Pamela's. It tastes and cooks like wheat flour without the gluten. I've made pies, cakes and cookies, gravy, bread, etc with Pamela's and no one in my family can tell the difference. I love this flour!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Great bread flour
customer_reviews.text: Great product, great taste. Perfect for GF sandwich bread, toast, dinner bread. Be aware that this mix already has salt and sugar in it so if you use it for banana bread or other recipes you will need to adjust- recommend baking as instructed and then tweaking your recipes after you taste it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I miss this!
customer_reviews.text: I have Celiacs, and my doctor recommended this flour. It’s pretty close to amazing! No one in my family knew I made banana bread and red velvet cake with this! It’s not perfectly close to all purpose flour bc it always has a little heaviness /thickness to me, but no gritty or weird flavor at all! Please release more!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and better than pre-packaged.
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves it. It is certainly better than the store bought gluten free bread. She loved it coming out of the oven hot. The shelf life is about the same as the store bought packaged bread. It was easy to make; just use a stand mixer with paddle blades. The dough is more like a heavy batter. Mine did not rise much before putting in the oven. I'm guessing it was not warm enough to activate the yeast immediately, although I did use warm water. Certainly recommend this to those with gluten allergies.
customer_reviews.author: J. Vieke

customer_reviews.title: Best GF bread mix anywhere
customer_reviews.text: I love this bread mix! So easy to make and so, so tasty. I add 1/4 cup of ground flax seed and a tablespoon or two of molasses and it turns out like a whole wheat loaf. Awesome for toast or sandwiches. Supplies have been limited so I’ve been without for a while - so glad to have it back.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Flour mix.
customer_reviews.text: Finally finished the bag of this stuff and I learned a few valuable lessons. 1) do not use hot water when mixing in liquids. Everything you make will turn to goo. It's awful. 2) eggs are important. I don't typically eat them, but when I use flax eggs with this flour, my recipes fail. I love Pamela's brownie and cake mixes. Not sure now if I'm a crappy baker or if I don't love this mix. Oh, I made the recipe for muffins on the back with blueberries, they came out really tasty!
customer_reviews.author: K. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Hands down best gluten free flour
customer_reviews.text: By far the best gluten free flour! I have tried many many types of flour and Pamela’s is the easiest to use as a one to one replacement in regular recipes. This bread mix makes amazing pizza crusts. In fact my children, who are not gluten free, request I make this pizza crust. It’s simple to use, comes with the yeast packet in it, and even has recipes printed on the package as well as available online.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Does not work in a vertical bread machine
customer_reviews.text: I've tried making it five times and all five bread came out half the size of the bread pan. I followed the instructions to the tee, trying different types of temperature of the egg, water, etc. and wondered what I did wrong. Reading other reviews here, now I know that this mix does not work well in vertical bread machine. I wish I would have known that before I wasted five packets.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Y.

customer_reviews.title: Just a Basic flour, nothing special
customer_reviews.text: This is good for a basic AP Gluten Free, but really is expensive for what it is as a flavorless flour. It also leaves a bit of a gooey slippery feel on the tongue when used for bread. Maybe a bit too much tapioca starch, who knows, but I'll be making my own mix from now on. Thanks anyways.
customer_reviews.author: jp

customer_reviews.title: Great GF Flour
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for recipes with an easy substitution for regular flour. I still add a little Xanthan Gum but it does not have the grainy or crumbly texture that some GF flours offer, especially when making pancakes. The 4 pound size is perfect so I am not constantly getting more at the store. Will continue my subscription with this.
customer_reviews.author: Navman

customer_reviews.title: So Happy with this Gluten Free All Purpose Flour
customer_reviews.text: This is the very first gluten free all purpose flour I have tried and I am hooked. While I am getting used to the slightly different texture of it--aka, I make slight adjustments to the amount used for gluten flour recipes--the taste is comparable to my prior gluten version. I definitely appreciate Pamela's brand for providing me with an easy, tasty, and dependable gluten-free alternative.
customer_reviews.author: SSG

customer_reviews.title: The best GF flour!
customer_reviews.text: After bing gluten free and suffering through bad gf baked goods for 3 years, I found this flour and it has completely changed the way we think about gluten free food. I can make almost any recipe and make it taste great, and have the right texture, just by swapping out normal flour for this one. I have been buying it almost months through subscribe and save since that moment at least 2 years ago! We are loyal customers and will continue to be!
customer_reviews.author: Bailey Sims

customer_reviews.title: So far so good! I have been baking/eating gluten free for over ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I have been baking/eating gluten free for over six years now and I have to say that I am very impressed with this mix. It works the best with the Pamela's recipes provides on the package and on the website. After experimenting for years, I have seriously found the best tasting, best textured, and easiest pizza crust I have ever tasted. We can finally have a normal pizza again that isn't only 10" across and has a real flavor and substance to the bread. The dinner rolls (website recipe) was also very easy, tasted delicious, and had a nice fluffy texture to the roll. This is a really nice flour blend, I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Pusheen

customer_reviews.title: The best (for some things)
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has Celiacs disease. This is the only flour I currently use to make her cakes. Some recipes will not work well with this flour (like carrot cake) but other recipes are marvelous. The Mary Berry Chocolate cakes come out particularly tasty. The best part is that no one can guess they are made from a special flour. Also, I have made a variation of cookies from this flour with success. Oatmeal and peanut butter come out great, but don't try to make traditional snowball cookies; they just wont stick together.
customer_reviews.author: Elena B.

customer_reviews.title: Tastes very good. Their web site also has recipes to add ...
customer_reviews.text: Tastes very good. Their web site also has recipes to add additional flavor to your loaf. Follow the directions and you will be fine. I have an old bread machine that does not have a gluten-free setting, which is why I purchased this, since the directions are for the standard setting on the bread machine.
customer_reviews.author: mbflute

customer_reviews.title: but NOT good for common and easy substitutes like pancakes as it ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely all-purpose.. really only works with some recipes, but NOT good for common and easy substitutes like pancakes as it gets REALLY gummy and you need to add twice as much binder to get the consistency smooth and light.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Best GF all purpose flour
customer_reviews.text: This is a great all purpose gluten free flour. I have been gluten free for over three years and after trying every all purpose GF flour on the market and tried making my own, this is the best. I have made dozens of "normal" recipes using this flour to make the gluten free. It is great because it is cup for cup in measurement and you don't have to add anything else special. It has a good flavor (some GF flours have weird flavors) and the price is great. It is great to buy this and fill my flour container. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: Best ever gluten free flour!
customer_reviews.text: By far the best gluten free flour I have ever used, I have tried alot over the past 15 years and this is the best. I used it for pie pastry and the result was tasty flaky and had my non gluten free friends and family asking for more and the recipe for the pastry. Follow the instructions to the letter and cold everything...Ingredients..equipment and hands and it rolls out and handles perfectly. I am one very happy gluten free pie eater. Who ate all the pies? I did!!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Hamburger buns
customer_reviews.text: I use this mix for making hamburger buns and don't add the extra two tables of water it asks for and melted butter instead of oil. I put it on parchment in large spoon fulls and then either smooth it down with a wet spoon or use buttered parchment on top to flatten it with my hand. (bad sentence structure but hope you get what I mean.) Pop them out of the open, slice, and serve warm. My family thinks I am queen of the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon L. Barlow

customer_reviews.title: Lied about delivery, exceptionally undependable
customer_reviews.text: After weeks of pro!uses on a delivery, they defaulted. I understand we are in the throes of a pandemic, but e up front if you can't fulfill an order. Other bread companies manage. Another promise of delivery, no show.
customer_reviews.author: Craig S. Parker

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite gluten-free flour
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite gluten-free flour. The flavor is spot on, and I've mostly been able to substitute it 1:1 for regular flour, but you just have to go into any cooking project with the right expectations. Anything you make with this will tend to come out a lot more dense and chewy compared to regular flour, but you'll find that with just about any of the gluten-free flours out there.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Best flour I've tried.
customer_reviews.text: Followed the banana bread recipe on the package. Can't stop making it with all sorts of variations from less sugar to adding applesauce or nuts or raisins. Bread rises nicely and makes the best morning toast. This flour is a winner!
customer_reviews.author: Clea

customer_reviews.title: super easy to make
customer_reviews.text: super easy to make, even using a fork to mix the batter. First time out, added some flax seed and oatmeal flakes. Gluten free bread tends to be a little like cake, and crumbles in sandwiches - not just this product. But being able to have some toast now and again, or even make French toast is awesome. and so much cheaper than most of the "artisan" type gluten free breads.
customer_reviews.author: Candace

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Just Follow Directions
customer_reviews.text: We adore Pamela's Gluten Free Bread Mix! Since learning we needed to become a gluten free home due to allergies, we thought bread was never an option. With Pamela's help, if you follow the directions, you'll successfully bake a delicious loaf of bread everyone can enjoy. No one will notice the difference, including those who are not "gluten sensitive" or "gluten intolerant". Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: MoncrieffFamily

customer_reviews.title: Easy baking with a 1 to 1 ratio
customer_reviews.text: Ships fine without any spilt flour. Nice fine flour for baking. I add sorghum flour and flax meal to make bread and almond flour to pancakes and things that need texture.. but for fine baking; cookies, pie, cakes, biscuits, this does the trick without much fuss.
customer_reviews.author: Julienne

customer_reviews.title: buy this to get bagels, but watch out for your GF baker's reputation
customer_reviews.text: Hubby started making bagels from this mix (not telling anyone it's a mix; he just whips 'em up), and handing them out to friends who are all in awe because he gets up early and mixes bagels from this bag. OK, they're good bagels and he even adds a slurry for making sesame and poppy seeds stick. But c'mon. I mix flours, order and try out all the GF cookbooks we own, order gums, perfect bread recipes, bake challahs even. I was the renowned gluten free baker in the house. And now HE'S the GF baker just because of this damned bag? What the? Thanks a lot, Pamela.
customer_reviews.author: Vilna Bashi Treitler

customer_reviews.title: This is the best cup for cup gf flour I have found to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best cup for cup gf flour I have found to date! This is perfect for baking. When I first tried this flour I didn't tell anyone I had switched it out from gluten flour. I used the Pamela's to do all my Christmas baking. When I shared the treats at our Big family no one could tell the difference! Give this flour a try! You will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Kelli D.

customer_reviews.title: This isn't good for lighter products
customer_reviews.text: This isn't good for lighter products. As soon as it hits liquid, it gets gummy and difficult to deal with. Pancakes are awful. I've been doing this gluten free thing for ten years and have tried so many flour blends. This one may work for cookies, and I appreciate that it is dairy free so my boys can eat it, but the sheer gummy-ness of it keeps me from buying it again. Why can't anyone make an affordable blend that doesn't involve rice flour?!
customer_reviews.author: L. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Very strange mixture!!! Doesn’t work to make or bake almost anything: I tried pancakes and bread and it was a disaster!!!! All my ingredients (eggs, coconut milk etc.) throwen away!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Petronela gianina

customer_reviews.title: So easy to make with bread machine
customer_reviews.text: So easy to make with bread machine. And my machine is not a fancy new one. Bread tastes so very good. Rather fun putting it together and strong sense of accomplishment when it’s done and I say I did it myself. Package directions are so easy but don’t worry about being very exact with measurements. Bread turns out fine anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Forest

customer_reviews.title: One of My Favorites!
customer_reviews.text: Love the flour but I will never like the price. I wish all gluten free flours could have a price reduction!
customer_reviews.author: CatS

customer_reviews.title: Delicious
customer_reviews.text: This is quite different than making homemade rolls with wheat flour, but they are excellent and even our non-gluten free family enjoyed them. They cannot be shaped as the dough is very loose. We wanted to shape into rolls but ended up using an ice-cream scoop and baking in a muffin tin. They turned out great.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gluten-free flour
customer_reviews.text: Excellent gluten-free flour that works very well as a direct replacement for wheat flour. I've used this for breading meat, for baking cakes, cookies, brownies, etc. and the results have been uniformly great. Prior to trying this flour, I usedand was largely disappointed by the funky taste. Pamela's flour is quite an improvement over Bob's.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Christianson

customer_reviews.title: The best gluten free flour blend I have found
customer_reviews.text: This is the best gluten free flour blend I’ve found yet. And trust me, I’ve tried... close to all of them. I love that it comes in a giant bag. It works great for most things.
customer_reviews.author: PerfectPeanutTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Hearty, tasty bread
customer_reviews.text: My biggest concern with a gluten free diet was that people told me of the horrible bread choices. However, the Pamela's gluten free bread is excellent and good enough to eat even without a health issue. The bread is very dense, with a fair sweetness. All one needs to add is oil, water and eggs - the mix even includes yeast. I will not even try any other gluten free bread.
customer_reviews.author: Bubbles

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use & no bean flour
customer_reviews.text: I have IBS not celiac but sometimes my gut objects to gluten flours. This blend is easy to use in place of Gold Medal. I only wish it had more fiber! Also important to me because my IBS always flares for days from beans like fava / garbonzo and others. Most other gluten-free all purpose flour mixes include those bean flours.
customer_reviews.author: nem11az

customer_reviews.title: We've ordered his several times and love it. We are a family of 5 and ...
customer_reviews.text: We've ordered his several times and love it. We are a family of 5 and are totally gf. This makes eating gf a bit more affordable. For a hassle free gf bread, I just use the recipe in Pamela's website. I feel like it's less nutritious than breads with mixed grains but it has worked well when I needed a hassle free alternative. We mix this half and half with Bob's Red Mill GF flour for a nutritional boost. Bob's is mostly garbanzo which has a strong flavor but when mixed it works well as a base for quick breads, cookies, and pancakes.
customer_reviews.author: georgia b.

customer_reviews.title: Gooey the last couple of times
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for years, but the last few times I did it, it didn't cook all the way through. I am using the same bread machine. I can't find a date anywhere on the bag and wonder if the yeast is old. Too expensive to have to throw away 2 piles of goo.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy B

customer_reviews.title: Makes some good tasting toast
customer_reviews.text: I use this and substitute applesauce for eggs and baking soda for the yeast. Makes some good tasting toast. I had used it in past, just not using the eggs I knew I had a problem with and still had itching and rashes. I did home a food sensitivity test and found out yeast was also a problem for me. Hopefully, I finally have a bread I can eat without consequences.
customer_reviews.author: T Thom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to make and quickly gone
customer_reviews.text: The best tasting and the easiest GF bread I have ever made. My Grandson & son in law have Celiac, so besides making a loaf of bread, I put small amounts of dough in small round baking dishes and make buns for hamburgers and sandwiches. We add a 1/3 cup of jalapeno and Mexican cheese. This adds a wonderful flavor for sandwiches. I even made some Hoagie buns today. I have many people that love this bread and they have no allergy to wheat
customer_reviews.author: Peg

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best mix
customer_reviews.text: I have tried lots of GF mixes with varying results. This one is by far the best. It. It made a great pie crust that held together, was able to be rolled out, and did not require an egg. Very flavorful too. Love this mix!!
customer_reviews.author: Doxie Mom

customer_reviews.title: Still looking for the perfect GF bread mix
customer_reviews.text: When I first came to know I had Celiacs disease, I bought all the different frozen GF breads in the supermarket. Gawdawful. Bought a bread machine and slicer, then investigated recipes. This is great, but not perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Please don’t buy this
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely despise leaving bad reviews, but this product is disgusting. I used this flour to make some pancakes and instead of batter, it turned to, like... dough? I had to wash my hands and mixing bowl four times because they practically had slimy clay in them from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gluten free flour blend
customer_reviews.text: I use this blend for all my baking. Though no gluten free flour is just like regular flour, Pamela's Artisan blend works for cakes better than others I have tried. No one has been able to tell that my pound cakes are gluten free.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Many uses and tastes great
customer_reviews.text: Being celiac, I've found Pamela's products are the best tasting gluten free items. I've used this flour to make gravies, cookies, cakes, muffins, pies, and batter for fried chicken. My family can't tell the difference. I highly recommend all of Pamela's products if you need to eat gluten free.
customer_reviews.author: Wanderlust Addict

customer_reviews.title: Delicious gluten free bread!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this is amazing bread! I use an egg substitute and it’s still fabulous. It’s not as dense as most gluten free bread but not fluffy, it has that wonderful homemade bread flavor. I have it for sandwiches or use with an olive oil dipping sauce to just eat alone, it has an amazing flavor. I haven’t had decent bread in years so this is quite a treat.
customer_reviews.author: Designers Style

customer_reviews.title: Good product at a good price from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I used to mix my own gluten free flour mix but this is available with prime shipping at a reasonable price so I gave it a try. It works well in my recipes but keep in mind that it already has guar gum so added xantham is not needed. Don't use it in recipes that don't call for xantham. I keep another gf flour mix on hand for those recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Upstate gal

customer_reviews.title: Best GF flour hands down
customer_reviews.text: I have celiac and have tried many gf flour blends over the many years. I feel this is the best. Baked goods taste normal and cookies do not fall apart. I am a Pamela's artisan flour customer for life.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Hahn

customer_reviews.title: Good taste and texture, works well in Zojurishi bread machine
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best tasting of all the gf breads I have tried. That being said, it doesn't compare to a traditional loaf but if you are on a gf diet, this is probably your best bet. It attains a loft in my Zojirushi bread machine equal to about 3/4 of the pan height following the recipe exactly. Bread machines vary so depending on what you have you may need to make modifications.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Gargo

customer_reviews.title: Gluten free flour
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the beat gluten free flour but when I received my order one of the bags was already open as it looks like it was sliced with a razor blade. Very sad as it makes me not want to order again
customer_reviews.author: bonnie j moser

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful gluten free bread
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to use, simple to make breadmaker gluten-free bread. This is my "go-to" bread mix. Won't be without this or their flour. They also have a pizza flour that is also wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Bett E Crocker

customer_reviews.title: Great gluten free bread!
customer_reviews.text: My wife was gluten free and couldn’t find any bread that didn’t taste like cardboard and disappointment until she tried Pamela’s. I put this in the bread maker as instructed and she loved it. Bought it so many times. Would recommend to anyone that is gluten free and needs that bread fix.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Cassel

customer_reviews.title: Great Find - Love this Bread
customer_reviews.text: This is prolly the best item I've found on amazon. I was very skeptical that a GF bread could be good AND easy, but this is BOTH. The texture is PERFECT- this is soft and moist and delicious. I spend at most 5 minutes getting this started in my bread maker. Then the house smells AWESOME as this bakes Even non GF family members comment about the wonderful smell. I love toast every morning with this bread. Do slice this all while it is still warm - it's a bit easier to slice. Coming from my bread maker - this bread is HUGE - for sandwiches... not like the teeny tiny slices I get from UDI's
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love Pamela's Products
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love Pamela's Products! They are the best gluten free by far! HOWEVER- I ordered 1 25lb bag and received 3! And at $47 PER bag that's not a little boo-boo. I can't decide to send 2 back and order them fresh when I need them later... I love the company so much I hate to cost them any mistakes...but maybe they'll see this review and compensate somehow....Humm.. 🌹Pam is the Queen! 🌹
customer_reviews.author: mim

customer_reviews.title: No exaggeration...best gluten free bread I’ve ever eaten!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has celiac disease. She was diagnosed over a year ago. I, also, have been eating gluten free due to autoimmune issues. I have searched and searched for the best gluten-free free bread recipe...and I’ve finally found it! This product seriously exceeded my expectations. Bread that is soft...and moist...yet, with a perfect crust. I’d say the best review comes from our gluten eating family members. They both commented that they would not have known that this bread is gluten free if I had not told them. I made my loaf in my Zojirushi BB-PAC20 bread maker and followed the package directions. I will MOST DEFINITELY be ordering more of this item!!! I highly recommend that you do, as well!
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Watts

customer_reviews.title: It isn't at all like the other Gluten Free All Purpose or Gluten Free ...
customer_reviews.text: I am an experienced Gluten Free cook and I have used numerous Pamela's products. However, this product was a failure in every way I tried to use it. It isn't at all like the other Gluten Free All Purpose or Gluten Free One to Onr or Cup for Cup flours. I will never purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: SouthernBelle

customer_reviews.title: A Miss for Pamela
customer_reviews.text: I have been baking gluten free for 10 years and I typically love all of Pamela's products. This flour, however, is disappointing. It leaves most baked goods rubbery and dense. Opt instead for Bob's gluten free flour blend or make your own.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica C

customer_reviews.title: Love this bread mix
customer_reviews.text: Love this bread mix. I use apple sauce instead of the 1⁄3 c oil it calls for. I also add almond meal in place of 3/4 cup of the mix. Comes out perfectly in my bread machine every time. One more tip: Once the loaf has cooled, slice it and freeze slices on a cookie sheet for 1⁄2 hour, then freeze the slices in a ziplock. I put wax paper in between the slices. This is because non-gluten bread slices tend to stick together.
customer_reviews.author: ganini

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: The Best GF flour I've used. I portion this into containers and freeze it. It keeps well this way and I save a bit because GF isn't cheap! We can't tell the difference between regular and GF. So glad I can buy in bulk.
customer_reviews.author: M Schia

customer_reviews.title: Love this bread
customer_reviews.text: I have this on subscribe and save. We eat a loaf a week. Even my family members who aren't gluten free love it. Fresh bread out of the bread maker is the best. (you can make it in the oven too) I had a friend get diagnosed with celiac and this is the first thing I took to her.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Great price. Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Finally affordable gluten free bread. I use this to thicken sauces all the time. Behaves like flour. Love it! I use it for cookies too. Does not make a store bought style loaf of bleached wheat white bread but it more moist, has a different consistency, and takes longer to bake, but worth it because the result is more tasty. I use it in my breadmaker to make a variety of breads my kids love, banana with roasted sunflower seeds, cinnamon raisen, cheddar cheese, etc. Nice after going without for so long. I even use for pie shells, pizza crust, and muffins.
customer_reviews.author: Always Grateful

customer_reviews.title: CAN NOT RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: Nope! There are better products out there. This one just doesn't taste right. It isn't really worth the trouble. I'm a huge fan of Pamela's products - just not this one. I use their baking mix all the time.
customer_reviews.author: DisneyDenizen

customer_reviews.title: great substitute for flour
customer_reviews.text: My kids are allergic to gluten so I stared to use different type of gluten free products to make desert for my kids and it turn out not too bad. will continue purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Pamela's Products Gluten Free, Bread Mix, 19 Ounce , Pack of 6
product_meta.description: Flavor:Bread Mix| Size:6 PackAt Pamela's Products, we believe that taste comes first. That's why Pamela has created all the foods you crave, with the taste and texture you remember. We are proud to be a top-selling gluten-free brand, still delicious after 30 years.
feature_bullets: Case of six packages (total of 114 ounces)
To prevent bags from exploding during delivery, the manufacturer has added two food-grade pin holes on each bag during production

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
